newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary to offer over 13 pct of oil/gas firm MOL.
newsitem.headline: Hungary to offer over 13 pct of oil/gas firm MOL.

text.p: Hungary will offer at least 12.5 percent of the shares in oil and gas company MOL to international institutional investors and a minimum of one percent to domestic investors, the state privatisation agency APV said on Thursday.

For the global offering, APV granted the joint global co-ordinators -- Dresdner Kleinwort Benson and Salomon Brothers International -- an over-allotment option on a further 2.5 percent, APV said in a statement.
APV plans to hold an international roadshow in Europe, Asia, the Middle East and in North America between April 21 and May 2 and to price and allocate the shares on May 2.

The offering to Hungarian institutional and retail investors is expected to begin on May 9 on condition Hungary's securities market watchdog approves the prospectus. If demand for the shares in Hungary is larger than what is offered, a further one percent will be sold domestically.
Domestic retail investors will be allowed to subscribe in cash instalments, paying 30 percent at the subscription and the remainder by 15 May, 1998.
All shares offered globally and domestically will have the right to a dividend on 1996 results.
MOL Rt had 1996 net income of 22.2 billion HUF, a sharp rise from 1.1 billion in 1995.
MOL's registered capital is 98.4 billion forints.
